title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol1> has quit  
00:53 <kstuart> has quit  
00:53 <Slashman> has quit  
00:56 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
01:06 <kstuart> has quit

01:57 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki

02:15 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki

02:38 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki

02:56 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki

04:54 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
05:20 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
05:32 <kstuart> has quit  
05:35 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:36 <kstuart> has quit  
07:27 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <npm\_\_> has quit  
08:12 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
08:13 <mflorea> vmassol: good morning  
08:13 <vmassol> do you see anything wrong with http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3990/consoleText ?  
08:13 <vmassol> the error seems to be after the build has succeeded  
08:13 <vmassol> but there's no indication  
08:14 <vmassol> ah wait  
08:14 <vmassol> maybe some unit test failing  
08:14 <vmassol> hmm no  
08:15 <vmassol> ah yes 2 tests failing  
08:15 <mflorea> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3990/testReport/  
08:15 <mflorea> two failing tests  
08:15 <vmassol> I was looking at the raw output  
08:16 <vmassol> which is too difficult to read  
08:16 <vmassol> ok debugging those tests  
08:23 <vmassol> seems the LT is empty, checking why  
08:26 <vmassol> hmm that'es weird  
08:27 <vmassol> the json is correct and valid  
08:27 <vmassol> I only changed json generation so it's strange  
08:32 <vmassol> ok found a lead  
08:34 <vmassol> ok fond the problem  
08:34 <vmassol> the macros are not encapsulated and I missed that  
08:36 <vmassol> ok fixed, committing  
08:37 <mflorea> ok  
08:45 <mflorea> has quit  
08:48 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <vmassol> mflorea: hmm still failing locally, checking why  
09:19 <mflorea> failing on CI too  
09:19 <vmassol> must be some stupid copy paste I did since I got to work on my XE  
09:19 <vmassol> and I then backported to SCM  
09:24 <vmassol> found it  
09:24 <vmassol> grrr  
09:27 <vmassol> ok I've double checked this time, it should be fine  
09:33 <mflorea> :)  
09:35 <vmassol> mflorea: are we ready to release?  
09:35 <mflorea> as soon as the build passes  
09:35 <vmassol> ok cool  
09:35 <vmassol> Im building locally too to be extra sure  
09:36 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/ is ok?  
09:36 <vmassol> btw good job fixing the func tests :)  
09:39 <mflorea> re wysiwyg, there's one flicker I'm looking at right now  
09:41 <vmassol> ok great  
09:41 <vmassol> grrr locally: Exception in thread "Job Manager daemon thread" java.util.ConcurrentModificationException  
09:41 <vmassol> the usual one....  
09:41 <vmassol> a pity thomas didn't take the time to rewrite the test  
09:42 <mflorea> yes..  
09:48 <vmassol> btw and fwiw I've heard that selenium 3.0 is coming at the end of this year… don't know what will be in it though  
09:49 <vmassol> https://twitter.com/search?q=selenium%203.0&src=typd  
09:51 <vmassol> mflorea: build passed http://ci.xwiki.org/  
09:51 <mflorea> interesting.. I think I'll finally start to move wysiwyg tests to selenium 2, but in xwiki-platform-wysiwyg/xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-test (-pageobjects/tests). We may need to create a separate job for platform ui tests though  
09:52 <mflorea> yes, let's see the tests now  
09:52 <vmassol> lot of work indeed, but doing it slowly one by one should be ok  
09:52 <mflorea> yes  
09:57 <vmassol> msmeria: why not use test.xwiki.org? :)  
09:59 <msmeria> vmassol: you're right and I'm going to start using the new wiki. but now I tested a certain jira issue and I don't think we have a test just for it  
09:59 <vmassol> exactly  
10:00 <vmassol> that's why you should use it to create new tests!  
10:00 <vmassol> that's its purpose :)  
10:00 <vmassol> it should be easy to add new tests on test.xwiki.org  
10:00 <sburjan`> vmassol: is that vise ?  
10:00 <vmassol> if it's not then it's failing  
10:00 <vmassol> vise?  
10:00 <msmeria> wise  
10:00 <sburjan`> \*wise  
10:00 <vmassol> why not?  
10:00 <vmassol> that's its purpose  
10:00 <vmassol> :)  
10:01 <vmassol> to be able to add lots of tests and report their execution on given versions  
10:01 <sburjan`> we'll end up with thousand of tests if we add a test for each issue we have  
10:01 <vmassol> errr?  
10:01 <msmeria> I don't know if we should create tests for any specific jira issue...  
10:01 <vmassol> explain to me why hiding a test that you do makes it better?  
10:01 <sburjan`> exactly  
10:01 <vmassol> if you run a test it \*MUST\* be on test.xwiki.org  
10:01 <vmassol> any test  
10:01 <vmassol> otherwise it doesn't exist and doesn't cout  
10:01 <vmassol> count  
10:01 <sburjan`> because if we add it, it will \_always\_ show\_ up, meaning we will have to test it on each future release ?  
10:02 <vmassol> if test.xwiki.org is only for tests that exists on all versions of XE then you're going to have a big problem  
10:02 <vmassol> because we add or remove features  
10:02 <msmeria> or maybe we could add a test for each jira, but mark it in some way to know not to test it again for each release  
10:02 <vmassol> what you need to do  
10:02 <vmassol> on test.xwiki.org  
10:03 <vmassol> is be able to mark a test as valid only for a given version  
10:03 <vmassol> or a range of versions  
10:03 <vmassol> or a starting version  
10:03 <sburjan`> :(  
10:03 <vmassol> actually 2 fields  
10:03 <vmassol> starting version  
10:03 <vmassol> end version  
10:03 <vmassol> that allows new features to not appear for old versions  
10:03 <vmassol> and allow for removal of feature  
10:03 <vmassol> like tagcloud plugin for ex  
10:04 <vmassol> which was removed not that long ago  
10:04 <sburjan`> you should have given us this feedback when we requested it :(  
10:04 <vmassol> sburjan`: that's a pretty stupid comment sorry  
10:04 <vmassol> you should stop doing it if you believe in up front design  
10:04 <vmassol> s/it/IT  
10:05 <vmassol> it's been 20 years that only fool believe in up front design anymore :)  
10:05 <vmassol> well I'm exagerating a little, only 15 years  
10:05 <vmassol> this is why I've been telling you  
10:05 <vmassol> to release this app for one full year  
10:05 <vmassol> you kept it way too long in the closet  
10:05 <vmassol> there's only one way to know requirement  
10:05 <vmassol> is by using the app  
10:06 <vmassol> and iterate  
10:06 <sburjan`> well yes, but what you are proposing now is a model change. How should I handle this ? go back in dev mode, wait 2 more months ?  
10:06 <vmassol> and let me tell you a secret  
10:06 <sburjan`> tell me  
10:06 <vmassol> this app is going to change a lot in the future too  
10:07 <vmassol> gasp!!!  
10:07 <msmeria> :)  
10:07 <sburjan`> vmassol: yes, I can see that :) My big fear is how are we going to address backward compatibility, or the data the application already created ?  
10:07 <msmeria> we knew that, we just didn't think the change would come so fast after the release  
10:07 <vmassol> this is a very very very very minor change  
10:07 <vmassol> that takes about 1 hour to do  
10:08 <vmassol> you should be fine if you agree with it  
10:08 <vmassol> you'll live  
10:08 <sburjan`> ok. let's do it your way. But if I'll need help I hope you can help :)  
10:08 <sburjan`> I'd propose we start using the app for now, on how it is  
10:08 <vmassol> what I'm propsing  
10:08 <vmassol> is that we record all our tests on test.xwiki.org  
10:09 <vmassol> AFAIK that was your proposal too  
10:09 <vmassol> you just forgot about those tests  
10:09 <vmassol> now you jsut need to find a way to take them into account  
10:09 <vmassol> pretty simple  
10:09 <vmassol> not using test.xwiki.org would be a major failure  
10:09 <vmassol> it means that it's more complex to use test.xwiki.org than doing it in a plain page  
10:10 <sburjan`> vmassol: i get your point. but the app was created having in mind only the repetitive tests which have to be done on each release  
10:10 <vmassol> which would question the need for test.xwiki.org  
10:10 <vmassol> there's no such thing as repetitvie tests  
10:10 <sburjan`> I'll have to think of a way  
10:10 <vmassol> as I told you features come and go  
10:10 <sburjan`> yes, but annootations, comments won't go that soon  
10:10 <vmassol> and  
10:10 <vmassol> you add new tests  
10:10 <vmassol> that have not been executed on old versions  
10:11 <vmassol> ah annotations is a good one  
10:11 <sburjan`> yepp, that will happen  
10:11 <vmassol> it has changed drastically  
10:11 <vmassol> since it's been merged with comments  
10:11 <vmassol> so the tests for annoations  
10:11 <vmassol> are completely different in old versions and in new versions  
10:11 <vmassol> they're different tests thus  
10:11 <vmassol> and the old tests should be done on the new versions  
10:11 <vmassol> since now they are comments  
10:12 <vmassol> you're just proving my point thanks :)  
10:12 <vmassol> \*should be/shoud not be  
10:12 <npm\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <sburjan`> ok, I'll have to think of a way to mark a test as active/inactive and introduce a range of versions  
10:14 <sburjan`> but can we start using the app FTM ?  
10:14 <sburjan`> see how it goes, maybe you'll have even more feedback after we start using it  
10:16 <vmassol> sure I keep telling you to use the app ASAP  
10:16 <vmassol> but you're not doing it :(  
10:16 <vmassol> I've said that at least 3-4 times  
10:16 <vmassol> I don'tknow how to say it differently  
10:17 <sburjan`> you don't have. when you propose a change I always have the idea that the change must be done \_before\_ start using the app  
10:17 <sburjan`> so I feel like back to square 0  
10:17 <sburjan`> I've never done iterative dev, this is new for me and I lack knowledge on practices  
10:19 <vmassol> note that this is your work and you manage it the way you want, I'm just trying to push you to get some results and so that you can improve :)  
10:26 <mflorea> arr, tmortagne broke the build and I was about to release  
10:26 <vmassol> just now?  
10:26 <mflorea> 15min ago  
10:26 <vmassol> argh  
10:26 <vmassol> maybe revert his change?  
10:26 <vmassol> or branch before his change for the release  
10:29 <mflorea> going to revert  
10:30 <SvenDowideit\_> has quit  
10:33 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
11:56 <sburjan`> has quit  
11:56 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
13:03 <vmassol> mflorea: just did one commit on platform, very minor, hope it's ok  
13:06 <mflorea> vmassol: platform release was already started..  
13:07 <vmassol> ok  
13:07 <vmassol> we really need to do some cleanup of e.x.o  
13:07 <vmassol> to ensure all extensions are synced  
13:07 <vmassol> and have proper name/descriptions  
13:08 <mflorea> indeed  
13:29 <vmassol> mflorea: would be nice to have a "deprecated" metadata for extensions, so that the EM UI would displayed deprecated extension in a different style (greyed out for example)  
13:30 <vmassol> for example the "Columns Macro" is deprecated and has been replaced by the Container macro  
13:31 <vmassol> (http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-414)  
13:33 <mflorea> that would be useful indeed  
13:33 <mflorea> platform release failed... :(  
13:33 <vmassol> I see builds failed too on ci  
13:34 <mflorea> very bad timing if this is caused by infra work..  
13:34 <vmassol> indeed would be bad if it's the case  
13:35 <sburjan`> guys we have some troubles shutting down xwiki + tomcat .. the java process simply doesn't end by itself. It is a very annoying issue  
13:35 <vmassol> sburjan`: probably solr again  
13:35 <vmassol> on 5.1M2?  
13:36 <sburjan`> vmassol: I don'tget any traces, nothing  
13:36 <sburjan`> vmassol: yes, latest snapshot  
13:36 <vmassol> failure to stop means a thread doesn't want to stop  
13:36 <vmassol> you can take a stack dump  
13:36 <vmassol> pstack  
13:46 <mflorea> has quit  
14:16 <Denis> has quit  
14:17 <vmassol> I don't understand why groovy 2.1.5 is not found, it's there in the maven central repo  
14:17 <vmassol> Failed to execute goal on project xwiki-commons-groovy: Could not resolve dependencies for project org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-groovy:jar:5.1-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact org.codehaus.groovy:groovy-all:jar:2.1.5 in xwiki-releases (http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public) -  
14:17 <vmassol> why is it not found by our nexus  
14:17 <vmassol> ...  
14:27 <kstuart> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <kstuart> has quit  
15:08 <evalica> has quit  
15:24 <vmassol> nice PR from denisG  
15:25 <vmassol> would just need to convert to mockito but should be easy  
15:25 <vmassol> at least he added a unit test which is great  
15:25 <vmassol> ah this is bad:  
15:25 <vmassol> +    private final static String INDEXDIR = "target/luceneanalyzertest";  
16:02 <msmeria> has quit

17:56 <mflorea> \* Announcing the release on Twitter  
17:56 <mflorea> twidge-1.0.6-linux-i386-bin: user error (Bad response: 410)  
17:56 <mflorea> sdumitriu: any hints?  
17:57 <vmassol> mflorea: I can send the tweet if you want  
17:57 <mflorea> if you can, that would be great, http://purl.org/xwiki/rn/51M2  
17:58 <vmassol> ok doing it  
17:58 <mflorea> thanks  
17:59 <vmassol> done  
17:59 <mflorea> great, thanks
